definition: (located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
position/location/place/seat/classifier for people (honorific)/classifier for binary bits (e.g. 十六位 16-bit or 2 bytes)/(physics) potential

sentences.english: He may have been influenced by the prophet Isaiah whose ministry covered much of Hezekiah's reign.
sentences.chinese: 以赛亚主要是在希西家在位年间作先知的事奉。

sentences.english: If the king was still alive, he could unite the Mon Calamari and the Quarren.
sentences.chinese: 如果先王还在位，他会联合蒙卡拉马里人和夸伦人。
维多利亚女王自1837年到1901年在位。

sentences.english: They satirized her plastic surgeries and gossiped about her whereabouts.
sentences.chinese: 他们讽刺她做过整形手术，又不断人肉她的所在位置。

sentences.english: Identifying what you see does not tell where you are.
sentences.chinese: 辨识出你所见之物，并不能告诉你所在位置。

sentences.english: The king, who has reigned for six decades, is widely revered.
sentences.chinese: 广受尊崇的普密蓬国王已经在位六十余年。

sentences.english: Presence can be a status, history of activity, or location.
sentences.chinese: 存在可以是某种地位，历史记录，或所在位置。

sentences.english: And Chephren they said reigned fifty and six years.
sentences.chinese: 据他们说，齐夫林在位五十六年。

sentences.english: A queen dowager who is mother of the reigning sovereign.
sentences.chinese: 在位君主的母亲，先王的遗孀。

sentences.english: The longer he remains in office, the more violence we’re likely to see.
sentences.chinese: 他在位上停留的越久，我们可能看到的暴力也就越多。

sentences.english: Wangchuck on Thursday became the world's youngest reigning monarch.
sentences.chinese: 在这周四，旺楚克成为世界上最年轻的在位国王。

sentences.english: The situation was different when Birendra was the king.
sentences.chinese: 现在形势和比兰德拉在位是不同了。

sentences.english: Presidents are usually blamed for deficits run while they are in office.
sentences.chinese: 总统们通常会因其在位时的赤字管理而饱受责难。

sentences.english: I'm Queen Elizabeth II, and I've been on the throne for 60 years.
sentences.chinese: 我就是女王伊丽莎白二世，我已经在位60年。

sentences.english: Third, draw the location of individuals from the square on paper.
sentences.chinese: 于方格纸上画出其所在位置。

sentences.english: Unfortunatelly he still there and controls the army.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，他仍然在位并控制军队。

definition: to come to power/to hold power/in office
to succeed to a title/to inherit
to found a state/to open a closed country
temple name of a deceased Chinese emperor
reign title/era name (name for either the entire reign of an emperor or one part of it)/year number (such as 2016 or 甲子)
to hold a court audience/to govern from the imperial throne (applies esp. to Empress Dowager or Regent)
